data.title: Surprise Delivery!
data.text: Husband and I were suffering from jet lag, too tired to venture out, so ordered this to deliver to our hotel.  Did not expect much - but we were so pleasantly surprised!  The pizza was delicious!  Crust very flavorful and toppings were top notch!

data.title: Enjoy the Pizza
data.text: We arrived late afternoon so it was easy to park in the lot along the side of the building. I had to locate the greeter since some of the young employees seemed to be deep in conversation near the bar. She then tossed the menus on a small table and walked away. So customer service wasn't stellar but the pizza was delicious. The thin crust pizza was just right--not like a cracker but not too thick so that I could eat a whole 10-in. personal pizza. Sauce and cheese also very good. An older building but still pleasant inside. We would probably return if we were in the area again. It's not far from the Embassy Suites where we stayed.

data.title: Good italian place
data.text:
Visited duringa business trip to San Francisco.  Close to the airport, easy parking and nice setting.

Excellent place for Italian food, recommend the polenta and chicken parmigiano.

data.title: Great pizza. Close to airport
data.text: My husband and I wanted to stop for a bite before heading to the airport.  We had fast, friendly service and the pizza was great. Thin crust and super cheesy. The only reason for a 4 rating instead of 5; they had beer and wine only.

data.title: Cute little hole in the wall
data.text: Excellent salad and soup. Pizza homemade style with generous toppings.  Service as very satisfactory.  Will return next time in the area especially for happy hour.

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: Visiting from the Northeast, the only kind of pizza you get is thin crust or Sicilian style. This is a perfect blend of the two. The dough was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The sauce was not too sweet and not too bitter. The cheese was melty and delicious. They also deliver to nearby hotels at no extra charge. Great pizza!

data.title: Date night
data.text: A solid option for a date night, we come in here once or twice a month. We always order a bottle of red wine order a couple dishes and take our time. The ambience is a little moody and romantic. We never have too wait too long for a table, the owner/manager is always very friendly. Minestrone soup is always on point. Good for a low key, local, romantic night.

data.title: Family Owned Pride
data.text: The family pride was evident from the inviting atmosphere & welcoming staff to the preparation of the dishes. The kitchen is open so one can see the care that goes into preparing your menu selection. I cannot recall the name of what I ordered but it was a polenta roll with spinach, tomatoes and mozzarella. It was delicious!!! My only regret is not asking for the recipe!!!! I will definitely be coming back during my next visit to San Francisco.

data.title: A good choice.
data.text: Before leaving SFO: Close to hotel area, excellent parking (lot next to restaurant), Sierra Nevada Pale Ale on tap, service great. Had soup and pizza, both good and reasonably priced.

data.title: Okay dinner, but staff very friendly
data.text: We are on our way to San Francisco.  The price was right.  My pizza was good, but my spouse had Veal and it wasn't tender.  His veggies were over cooked as well.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Always a favorite for us!  We get a 10" pizza and broccoli penne.   Hits the spot.  Nice,  quiet after a cross country flight.   Just what we need,  some delish comfort food!

data.title: Easy and delicious
data.text: Solid menu, attentive service, nice glass wines, and really tasty pizza. Grabbed a quick dinner before settling into one of the local hotels for the night on a business stopover, and will definitely return. Only downside: no 'death by chocolate' dessert!

data.title: ok
data.text: Another city......another Italian & to be fair....another winner. Great craft beer & terrific pizzas. Really enjoyed them & highly recommended!!!

data.title: Not sure how they earned 3rd best
data.text:
My kids and I decided to come to the restaurant after noticing it was ranked#3 on trip advisor. When we arrived there was only one other table sitting.   Another family cane in after us, and it was obvious that we drew the short straw on waitresses. 
There table was brought bread and water.   Our waitress did take our drink order and brought drinks. After about 5 minutes I asked the fortunate tables waitress if she would get our waitress for us.  After she arrived, I asked about water and bread and she said they didn't have bread. I told her that the other family that came in after us had bread, and she said "yeah, their waitress gave them the last of the bread". But she did bring us water.  So lasagna without bread.
Food was good, but if this is the 3rd best if 230 restaurants in the area I would be shocked.  Also odd that only two families eating here at 8:30 on a Thursday.

data.title: Unexpected Find
data.text: My collegue and I wandered into this restaurant on the Sunday before the 4th of July and found it to be a nice little place.  Ambience was ok but not overwhelming and the food was surprisingly good.  We shared an appetizer of Polenta stuffed with spinach and cheese then finished with a brown butter...very good!  My salad was ample and very tasty and my friend spoke highly of the pasta with chicken.  Pricing is reasonable and the service was efficient and food was quick.  Would definately return.

data.title: Good quick eats.
data.text: Went for a quick bite. We were not that hungry. Pizza was good and so was pasta. Will definitely go again. Service was good.

data.title: Nice lunch
data.text: Friendly staff and tasty food. Decor is typical Italian restaurant. Salads were fresh and large. We lived the house dressing. 11 inch pizzas and design your own pizza was perfect. Panni was large and tasty. The pasta dishes were cooked perfectly and fresh Parmesan was available. Nice wine list to compliment the meal.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: We stopped here and had great pizza and chicken piccata!  The bread was also some of the best we've had!  The wait staff was very friendly and attentive.

data.title: Don't sit in the booths
data.text: I had reserved a table on line. When we arrived I told the young man (21) that we had a reservation. He did not acknowledge it. Put us in a group of small tables. One half booth and half hard back chairs. When the third member of our group arrived she asked to sit in the large booths which we were told were reserved. We sat there anyway and this caused a funny face on the bus boy/waiter. He decided not to wait on us. When my friends went to find the bar to order drinks he came by and said u have to order at the table. He took the drink order. Note: we got no water or bread but the people at the tables did. He then came back and asked what we wanted. The food was good and the service not so good. I guess you get a waitress if u sit at the tables but not in the booths. No one ever came to sit in the booths. I used to go to this restaurant years ago. In fact I remember when it opened. they had specials and great food and a chef who would come out and make sure the food was okay. There are different owners of course but I won't go back due to the rude service.

data.title: Try the pizza
data.text: We are here twice in a week on a business trip. The food was very good. The prices are great for fresh food and doesn't hurt the budget like other San Francisco locations.
